19#include "ODCodabarReader.h"
20#include "Result.h"
21#include "BitArray.h"
22#include "DecodeHints.h"
23#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"
24
25#include <array>
26#include <limits>
27#include <string>
28#include <vector>
29
30namespace ZXing {
31namespace OneD {
32
33// These values are critical for determining how permissive the decoding
34// will be. All stripe sizes must be within the window these define, as
35// compared to the average stripe size.
36static const float MAX_ACCEPTABLE = 2.0f;
37static const float PADDING = 1.5f;
38
39static const char ALPHABET[] = "0123456789-$:/.+ABCD";
40
41// These represent the encodings of characters, as patterns of wide and narrow bars. The 7 least-significant bits of
42// each int correspond to the pattern of wide and narrow, with 1s representing wide and 0s representing narrow.
43static const int CHARACTER_ENCODINGS[] = {
44 0x03, 0x06, 0x09, 0x60, 0x12, 0x42, 0x21, 0x24, 0x30, 0x48, // 0-9
45 0x0c, 0x18, 0x45, 0x51, 0x54, 0x15, 0x1A, 0x29, 0x0B, 0x0E, // -$:/.+ABCD
46};
47
48static_assert(Size(ALPHABET) - 1 == Size(CHARACTER_ENCODINGS), "table size mismatch");
49
50// minimal number of characters that should be present (inclusing start and stop characters)
51// under normal circumstances this should be set to 3, but can be set higher
52// as a last-ditch attempt to reduce false positives.
53static const int MIN_CHARACTER_LENGTH = 3;
54
55// official start and end patterns
56static const char* STARTEND_ENCODING = "ABCD";
57// some codabar generator allow the codabar string to be closed by every
58// character. This will cause lots of false positives!
59
60// some industries use a checksum standard but this is not part of the original codabar standard
61// for more information see : http://www.mecsw.com/specs/codabar.html
62
63/**
64* Records the size of all runs of white and black pixels, starting with white.
65* This is just like recordPattern, except it records all the counters, and
66* uses our builtin "counters" member for storage.
67* @param row row to count from
68*/
69static bool
70InitCounters(const BitArray& row, std::vector<int>& counters)
71{
72 // Start from the first white bit.
73 auto i = row.getNextUnset(row.begin());
74 if (i == row.end())
75 return false;
76
77 auto li = i;
78 while ((i = row.getNextSetTo(i, !*i)) != row.end()) {
79 counters.push_back(static_cast<int>(i - li));
80 li = i;
81 }
82 counters.push_back(static_cast<int>(i - li));
83
84 return true;
85}
86
87// Assumes that counters[position] is a bar.
88static int
89ToNarrowWidePattern(const std::vector<int>& counters, int position)
90{
91 int counterLength = Size(counters);
92 int end = position + 7;
93 if (end >= counterLength) {
94 return -1;
95 }
96
97 int maxBar = 0;
98 int minBar = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
99 for (int j = position; j < end; j += 2) {
100 int currentCounter = counters[j];
101 if (currentCounter < minBar) {
102 minBar = currentCounter;
103 }
104 if (currentCounter > maxBar) {
105 maxBar = currentCounter;
106 }
107 }
108 int thresholdBar = (minBar + maxBar) / 2;
109
110 int maxSpace = 0;
111 int minSpace = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
112 for (int j = position + 1; j < end; j += 2) {
113 int currentCounter = counters[j];
114 if (currentCounter < minSpace) {
115 minSpace = currentCounter;
116 }
117 if (currentCounter > maxSpace) {
118 maxSpace = currentCounter;
119 }
120 }
121 int thresholdSpace = (minSpace + maxSpace) / 2;
122
123 int bitmask = 1 << 7;
124 int pattern = 0;
125 for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
126 int threshold = (i & 1) == 0 ? thresholdBar : thresholdSpace;
127 bitmask >>= 1;
128 if (counters[position + i] > threshold) {
129 pattern |= bitmask;
130 }
131 }
132
133 return IndexOf(CHARACTER_ENCODINGS, pattern);
134}
135
136static int
137FindStartPattern(const std::vector<int>& counters)
138{
139 int counterLength = Size(counters);
140 for (int i = 1; i < counterLength; i += 2) {
141 int charOffset = ToNarrowWidePattern(counters, i);
142 if (charOffset >= 0 && IndexOf(STARTEND_ENCODING, ALPHABET[charOffset]) >= 0) {
143 // Look for whitespace before start pattern, >= 50% of width of start pattern
144 // We make an exception if the whitespace is the first element.
145 int patternSize = 0;
146 for (int j = i; j < i + 7; j++) {
147 patternSize += counters[j];
148 }
149 if (i == 1 || counters[i - 1] >= patternSize / 2) {
150 return i;
151 }
152 }
153 }
154 return -1;
155}
156
157static bool
158ValidatePattern(const std::vector<int>& charOffsets, const std::vector<int>& counters, int start)
159{
160 // First, sum up the total size of our four categories of stripe sizes;
161 std::array<int, 4> sizes = {};
162 std::array<int, 4> counts = {};
163
164 // We break out of this loop in the middle, in order to handle
165 // inter-character spaces properly.
166 int pos = start;
167 for (int index : charOffsets) {
168 int pattern = CHARACTER_ENCODINGS[index];
169 for (int j = 6; j >= 0; j--) {
170 // Even j = bars, while odd j = spaces. Categories 2 and 3 are for
171 // long stripes, while 0 and 1 are for short stripes.
172 int category = (j & 1) + (pattern & 1) * 2;
173 sizes[category] += counters[pos + j];
174 counts[category]++;
175 pattern >>= 1;
176 }
177 // We ignore the inter-character space - it could be of any size.
178 pos += 8;
179 }
180
181 // Calculate our allowable size thresholds using fixed-point math.
182 float maxes[4];
183 float mins[4];
184 // Define the threshold of acceptability to be the midpoint between the
185 // average small stripe and the average large stripe. No stripe lengths
186 // should be on the "wrong" side of that line.
187 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
188 mins[i] = 0.0f; // Accept arbitrarily small "short" stripes.
189 mins[i + 2] = ((float)sizes[i] / counts[i] + (float)sizes[i + 2] / counts[i + 2]) / 2.0f;
190 maxes[i] = mins[i + 2];
191 maxes[i + 2] = (sizes[i + 2] * MAX_ACCEPTABLE + PADDING) / counts[i + 2];
192 }
193
194 // Now verify that all of the stripes are within the thresholds.
195 pos = start;
196 for (int index : charOffsets) {
197 int pattern = CHARACTER_ENCODINGS[index];
198 for (int j = 6; j >= 0; j--) {
199 // Even j = bars, while odd j = spaces. Categories 2 and 3 are for
200 // long stripes, while 0 and 1 are for short stripes.
201 int category = (j & 1) + (pattern & 1) * 2;
202 int size = counters[pos + j];
203 if (size < mins[category] || size > maxes[category]) {
204 return false;
205 }
206 pattern >>= 1;
207 }
208 pos += 8;
209 }
210 return true;
211}
212
213CodabarReader::CodabarReader(const DecodeHints& hints)
214{
215 _returnStartEnd = hints.returnCodabarStartEnd();
216}
217
218Result
219CodabarReader::decodeRow(int rowNumber, const BitArray& row, std::unique_ptr<DecodingState>&) const
220{
221 std::vector<int> counters;
222 counters.reserve(80);
223 if (!InitCounters(row, counters)) {
224 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
225 }
226 int startOffset = FindStartPattern(counters);
227 if (startOffset < 0) {
228 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
229 }
230
231 int nextStart = startOffset;
232 std::vector<int> charOffsets;
233 charOffsets.reserve(20);
234 do {
235 int charOffset = OneD::ToNarrowWidePattern(counters, nextStart);
236 if (charOffset < 0) {
237 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
238 }
239 // Hack: We store the position in the alphabet table into a
240 // StringBuilder, so that we can access the decoded patterns in
241 // validatePattern. We'll translate to the actual characters later.
242 charOffsets.push_back(charOffset);
243 nextStart += 8;
244 // Stop as soon as we see the end character.
245 if (charOffsets.size() > 1 && IndexOf(STARTEND_ENCODING, ALPHABET[charOffset]) >= 0) {
246 break;
247 }
248 } while (nextStart < Size(counters)); // no fixed end pattern so keep on reading while data is available
249
250 // Look for whitespace after pattern:
251 int trailingWhitespace = counters[nextStart - 1];
252 int lastPatternSize = 0;
253 for (int i = -8; i < -1; i++) {
254 lastPatternSize += counters[nextStart + i];
255 }
256
257 // We need to see whitespace equal to 50% of the last pattern size,
258 // otherwise this is probably a false positive. The exception is if we are
259 // at the end of the row. (I.e. the barcode barely fits.)
260 if (nextStart < Size(counters) && trailingWhitespace < lastPatternSize / 2) {
261 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
262 }
263
264 if (!ValidatePattern(charOffsets, counters, startOffset)) {
265 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
266 }
267
268 // Translate character table offsets to actual characters.
269 std::string decodeRowResult;
270 decodeRowResult.reserve(charOffsets.size());
271 for (int index : charOffsets) {
272 decodeRowResult += ALPHABET[index];
273 }
274 // Ensure a valid start and end character
275 if (IndexOf(STARTEND_ENCODING, decodeRowResult.front()) < 0) {
276 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
277 }
278 if (IndexOf(STARTEND_ENCODING, decodeRowResult.back()) < 0) {
279 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
280 }
281
282 // remove stop/start characters character and check if a long enough string is contained
283 if (Size(decodeRowResult) <= MIN_CHARACTER_LENGTH) {
284 // Almost surely a false positive ( start + stop + at least 1 character)
285 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
286 }
287
288 if (!_returnStartEnd) {
289 decodeRowResult = decodeRowResult.substr(1, decodeRowResult.size() - 2);
290 }
291
292 int runningCount = 0;
293 for (int i = 0; i < startOffset; i++) {
294 runningCount += counters[i];
295 }
296 int xStart = runningCount;
297 for (int i = startOffset; i < nextStart - 1; i++) {
298 runningCount += counters[i];
299 }
300 int xStop = runningCount;
301 return Result(decodeRowResult, rowNumber, xStart, xStop, BarcodeFormat::CODABAR);
302}
303
304// each character has 4 bars and 3 spaces
305constexpr int CHAR_LEN = 7;
306// quite zone is half the width of a character symbol
307constexpr float QUITE_ZONE_SCALE = 0.5f;
308
309// official start and stop symbols are "ABCD"
310// some codabar generator allow the codabar string to be closed by every
311// character. This will cause lots of false positives!
312
313inline bool IsStartOrStopPattern(const PatternView& view)
314{
315 return Contains({0x1A, 0x29, 0x0B, 0x0E}, RowReader::NarrowWideBitPattern(view));
316}
317
318Result
319CodabarReader::decodePattern(int rowNumber, const PatternView& row, std::unique_ptr<DecodingState>&) const
320{
321 // minimal number of characters that must be present (including start, stop and checksum characters)
322 // absolute minimum would be 2 (meaning 0 'content'). everything below 4 produces too many false
323 // positives.
324 const int minCharCount = 4;
325 auto isStartOrStopSymbol = [](char c) { return 'A' <= c && c <= 'D'; };
326
327 auto next = ZXing::FindPattern<CHAR_LEN>(row.subView(0, -minCharCount * CHAR_LEN), IsStartOrStopPattern, QUITE_ZONE_SCALE);
328 if (!next.isValid())
329 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
330
331 int xStart = next.pixelsInFront();
332 int maxInterCharacterSpace = next.sum() / 2; // spec actually says 1 narrow space, width/2 is about 4
333
334 std::string txt;
335 txt.reserve(20);
336 txt += DecodeNarrowWidePattern(next, CHARACTER_ENCODINGS, ALPHABET); // read off the start pattern
337
338 if (!isStartOrStopSymbol(txt.back()))
339 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
340
341 do {
342 // check remaining input width and inter-character space
343 if (!next.skipSymbol() || !next.skipSingle(maxInterCharacterSpace))
344 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
345
346 txt += DecodeNarrowWidePattern(next, CHARACTER_ENCODINGS, ALPHABET);
347 if (txt.back() < 0)
348 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
349 } while (!isStartOrStopSymbol(txt.back()));
350
351 // next now points to the last decoded symbol
352 // check txt length and whitespace after the last char. See also FindStartPattern.
353 if (Size(txt) < minCharCount || !next.hasQuiteZoneAfter(QUITE_ZONE_SCALE))
354 return Result(DecodeStatus::NotFound);
355
356 // remove stop/start characters
357 if (!_returnStartEnd)
358 txt = txt.substr(1, txt.size() - 2);
359
360 int xStop = next.pixelsInFront() + next.sum() - 1;
361 return Result(txt, rowNumber, xStart, xStop, BarcodeFormat::CODABAR);
362}
363
364} // OneD
365} // ZXing
